wikipedia_page.main: Abraham (Abie) Wachner  (15 August 1892 – 23 August 1950) was the 35th Mayor of Invercargill from 1942 to 1950. He was awarded the OBE in 1946.

response: *  1892   – Abraham Wachner, New Zealand politician, 35th Mayor of Invercargill (d. 1950)
** Invercargill: Abraham Wachner (1942–1950), Eve Poole (1983–1992)Temple Sinai , NZ Jewish archives.
* 23 August: Abraham Wachner, 35th Mayor of Invercargill.
In 1947 he stood for the Invercargill mayoralty against incumbent Abraham Wachner. Denham polled respectably but was defeated by a margin of 997 votes.
* 15 August: Abraham Wachner, 35th Mayor of Invercargill.

There has been one woman mayor so far – Eve Poole. She has also been the only Jewish mayor, though earlier mayor Abraham Wachner was also of Jewish descent. A library building is named after Poole. She died in office in 1992. Tim Shadbolt was invited to run in the resulting by-election and claimed a surprising victory. Shadbolt is the current mayor. The 2010 election win made Shadbolt the longest-serving mayor in New Zealand, with this being his 8th mayoral term (his 6th term in Invercargill).
* Abraham Wachner – mayor of Invercargill. For patriotic and social welfare services.
The incumbent mayor Abraham Wachner sought another term, and was re-elected to the position despite a challenge from former Invercargill Borough Councillor and Labour MP William Denham.
